items.title: Collision with Greek coast guard boat leaves 15 migrants dead
items.standfirst: The coastguard said a pursuit was under way at the time of the collision, near the island of Chios.
items.content: The coastguard said a pursuit was under way at the time of the collision, near the island of Chios.

items.title: Migrant boat collision kills at least 15
items.standfirst: At least 15 people have died after a speedboat carrying migrants collided with a Coast Guard patrol vessel in Greece, with several others injured in the incident off the eastern Aegean island of Chios. A Coast Guard official said the crash occurred when the migrant boat manoeuvred towards the patrol vessel after being instructed to turn back. France24 correspondent Nathalie Savaricas reports the latest from Athens, Greece.
items.content: At least 15 people have died after a speedboat carrying migrants collided with a Coast Guard patrol vessel in Greece, with several others injured in the incident off the eastern Aegean island of Chios. A Coast Guard official said the crash occurred when the migrant boat manoeuvred towards the patrol vessel after being instructed to turn back. France24 correspondent Nathalie Savaricas reports the latest from Athens, Greece.

Continue reading...

items.title: US partial government shutdown ends, but DHS funding fight looms
items.standfirst: A deal between Senate Democrats and President Donald Trump has ended a short-lived partial US government shutdown, but funding for the Department of Homeland Security remains up in the air as lawmakers push for reforms to ICE and Border Patrol. Also in this edition: the EU seeks a partnership with Washington on critical rare earth minerals.

items.title: Ukraine-Russia peace talks brokered by US begin in Abu Dhabi
items.standfirst: Negotiators from Ukraine, Russia and the United States began a second round of peace talks in Abu Dhabi on Wednesday, with the long-term fate of territory in eastern Ukraine the main sticking point in ending the four-year war. The head of the Ukrainian delegation, Rustem Umerov, said Kyiv's team is seeking "a just and lasting peace". Charlotte Lam and Bilal Tarabey report.
items.content: Negotiators from Ukraine, Russia and the United States began a second round of peace talks in Abu Dhabi on Wednesday, with the long-term fate of territory in eastern Ukraine the main sticking point in ending the four-year war. The head of the Ukrainian delegation, Rustem Umerov, said Kyiv's team is seeking "a just and lasting peace". Charlotte Lam and Bilal Tarabey report.

items.title: Ukraine, Russia and United States gather in Abu Dhabi
items.standfirst: At least two people were killed by a Russian drone strike on Ukraine’s Dnipropetrovsk region on Wednesday, just hours before negotiators from Kyiv, Moscow and the United States are due to enter peace talks in Abu Dhabi. Several rounds of diplomacy between the sides have failed to strike a deal on ending Europe’s deadliest conflict since the Second World War. France24 International Affairs editor Oliver Farry tells us more.
items.content: At least two people were killed by a Russian drone strike on Ukraine’s Dnipropetrovsk region on Wednesday, just hours before negotiators from Kyiv, Moscow and the United States are due to enter peace talks in Abu Dhabi. Several rounds of diplomacy between the sides have failed to strike a deal on ending Europe’s deadliest conflict since the Second World War. France24 International Affairs editor Oliver Farry tells us more.

items.title: Libyan prosecutors open probe into killing of Gaddafi's son Seif al-Islam
items.standfirst: Libyan prosecutors said on Wednesday they will investigate the death of Seif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of the country's longtime leader Muammar Gaddafi, who was shot dead in his home in the city of Zintan on Tuesday. Seif al-Islam's lawyer said he had been killed by a "four-man commando" group who stormed his home.
items.content: Libyan prosecutors said on Wednesday they will investigate the death of Seif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of the country's longtime leader Muammar Gaddafi, who was shot dead in his home in the city of Zintan on Tuesday. Seif al-Islam's lawyer said he had been killed by a "four-man commando" group who stormed his home.

items.title: Son of Libya's late dictator Gaddafi killed in Zintan city
items.standfirst: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, a son of Libya’s late longtime ruler Muammar Gaddafi and once seen as his heir, has died, relatives said Tuesday, without providing details on the circumstances. His death was confirmed by an adviser on social media, while his cousin told Libyan media he had been killed in his home in Zintan by unidentified men.
items.content: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, a son of Libya’s late longtime ruler Muammar Gaddafi and once seen as his heir, has died, relatives said Tuesday, without providing details on the circumstances. His death was confirmed by an adviser on social media, while his cousin told Libyan media he had been killed in his home in Zintan by unidentified men.

items.title: Wegovy and Ozempic maker forecasts sharp drop in revenue for 2026
items.standfirst: Novo Nordisk share price plunges after blaming lower US drug prices, patent protection issues and rising competition The maker of Wegovy and Ozempic, Novo Nordisk, has predicted a sharp drop in revenues this year owing to a push by Donald Trump to lower US weight-loss drug prices, rising…
items.content: Novo Nordisk share price plunges after blaming lower US drug prices, patent protection issues and rising competition The maker of Wegovy and Ozempic, Novo Nordisk, has predicted a sharp drop in revenues this year owing to a push by Donald Trump to lower US weight-loss drug prices, rising…

items.title: Wegovy and Ozempic maker forecasts sharp drop in revenue for 2026
items.standfirst: Novo Nordisk share price plunges after blaming lower US drug prices, patent protection issues and rising competition The maker of Wegovy and Ozempic, Novo Nordisk, has predicted a sharp drop in revenues this year owing to a push by Donald Trump to lower US weight-loss drug prices, rising competition and the loss of key patent protections.Denmark’s Novo , once the poster-child for the growth in weight-loss treatments, said sales this year were likely to fall between 5% and 13%, despite the launch of its new Wegovy pill in the US. Its share price plummeted 18% on Wednesday morning, erasing all gains so far this year. In the past year the stock has lost nearly 50% of its value. Continue reading...
items.content: Novo Nordisk share price plunges after blaming lower US drug prices, patent protection issues and rising competition The maker of Wegovy and Ozempic, Novo Nordisk, has predicted a sharp drop in revenues this year owing to a push by Donald Trump to lower US weight-loss drug prices, rising competition and the loss of key patent protections.Denmark’s Novo , once the poster-child for the growth in weight-loss treatments, said sales this year were likely to fall between 5% and 13%, despite the launch of its new Wegovy pill in the US. Its share price plummeted 18% on Wednesday morning, erasing all gains so far this year. In the past year the stock has lost nearly 50% of its value. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Novo Nordisk predicts sharp drop in revenue
Company blames lower US drug prices and competition

clusters.neutral_headline: Spain Plans Social Media Ban for Under 16s

items.title: Elon Musk calls Spanish PM a ‘tyrant’ over plan to ban under-16s from social media and curb hateful content
items.standfirst: Pedro Sánchez says urgent action needed to protect children from ‘digital wild west’, drawing anger from owner of XSpain has proposed a ban on social media use by teenagers as attitudes hardened in Europe against the technology, drawing personal insults against the prime minister from Elon Musk.The government is preparing a series of measures including a social media ban for under-16s, the prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, said, promising to protect children from the “digital wild west” and hold tech companies responsible for hateful and harmful content. Continue reading...
items.content: Pedro Sánchez says urgent action needed to protect children from ‘digital wild west’, drawing anger from owner of XSpain has proposed a ban on social media use by teenagers as attitudes hardened in Europe against the technology, drawing personal insults against the prime minister from Elon Musk.The government is preparing a series of measures including a social media ban for under-16s, the prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, said, promising to protect children from the “digital wild west” and hold tech companies responsible for hateful and harmful content. Continue reading...

items.title: Spain announces plans to ban social media for under-16s
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez says the move will protect children from the "digital Wild West".
items.content: Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez says the move will protect children from the "digital Wild West".

ai_summary: Spain proposes ban on social media for minors
Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announces plan
Aim is to protect children from harmful content
Tech companies to be held responsible
Ban is part of digital protection measures

clusters.title: Art teacher critically injured by student in southern France school stabbing
clusters.neutral_headline: Art Teacher Stabbed by Student in France

items.title: Art teacher critically injured by student in southern France school stabbing
items.standfirst: A 14-year-old student in southern France stabbed an art teacher multiple times on Tuesday, leaving her in critical condition. Authorities said the attack appears linked to personal tensions, with no known political or religious motive, and the suspect has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder.
items.content: A 14-year-old student in southern France stabbed an art teacher multiple times on Tuesday, leaving her in critical condition. Authorities said the attack appears linked to personal tensions, with no known political or religious motive, and the suspect has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder.

items.title: France teacher fighting for life after knife attack by pupil
items.standfirst: A 14-year-old has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a stabbing in a classroom on Tuesday.
items.content: A 14-year-old has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a stabbing in a classroom on Tuesday.

ai_summary: Art teacher critically injured in stabbing
14-year-old student is suspect in attack
Incident occurred in southern France school
No known political or religious motive
Suspect arrested on suspicion of attempted murder

clusters.title: BBC reports from Oslo court ahead of rape trial of Crown Princess's son
clusters.neutral_headline: Norway Crown Princess Son on Rape Trial

items.title: BBC reports from Oslo court ahead of rape trial of Crown Princess's son
items.standfirst: Norway's royal family has been embroiled in recent scandals, including Crown Princess Mette-Marit links with Epstein.
items.content: Norway's royal family has been embroiled in recent scandals, including Crown Princess Mette-Marit links with Epstein.

items.title: Son of Norway's crown princess denies rape as trial begins
items.standfirst: The trial of the eldest son of Norway's crown princess on charges including rape has begun, after a set of new allegations were made against him.
items.content: The trial of the eldest son of Norway's crown princess on charges including rape has begun, after a set of new allegations were made against him.

ai_summary: Crown Princess son denies rape allegations
Trial begins in Oslo court
New allegations made against the son
Royal family embroiled in recent scandals
Son faces charges including rape
